name: Fish Traps

sections.heading: In the News
sections.content: Collection of news items from 1901-1905 about fish traps at Point Lawrence.

newsItems.content: Craft & Co., of Whatcom, are reported to be putting in a fish trap near Point Lawrence, Orcas island. Mr. Craft is the proprietor of the Famous Shoe Store and has for years been a constant advertiser in The Islander.
Mr. and Mrs. Craft, of Whatcom, and Mr. McDonald, state dairy commissioner, of Seattle, visited Mr. Craft's fish trap at Point Lawrence, Sunday. The little trap is doing finely.
Mr. and Mrs. Hansen and their two children returned to Fairhaven Tuesday for the winter. Mr. Hansen is interested in the Point Lawrence Fish Company's trap at the Alderbrook farm beach.

The Point Lawrence fish trap is nearly completed, having been driven out 200 feet or more further than it was last year. Owners of an adjoining location claim that as now located, the trap encroaches on their ground. The Point Lawrence Fish Company's trap in front of Patermoster's place is completed and a good catch is expected.

Damage was done to fish traps, especially to the P. P. & N. Co's big trap at Mosquito pass, the big A. P. A. Trap on the salmon banks, and the Wormer trap at the south end of Lopez. The Craft trap at Point Lawrence was also damaged.
Mr. Craft's trap is getting quite a lot of sockeyes.
There is some talk of Blaine parties driving the Craft trap at Point Lawrence.
Mr. Hansen came over from Bellingham Monday to superintend the work on the Craft-Hansen trap at Point Lawrence.
